member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient
member.summary:
A class that represents a single gRPC connection that can be used to handle a particular gRPC service's communication. This requires the CommunicationGateway DxM to be available.
'Channel' refers to a virtual connection to a conceptual endpoint in the DxM. 'Connection' refers to an active gRPC (HTTP2) connection with an endpoint. 'DataSource' refers to a conceptual endpoint and its identifying parameters.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.MyServicesGroupType
member.summary: The services group type for the instance of this base class. Helps to build the correct MessageBroker subjects.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.ChannelIdentifier
member.summary: The channel ID helps identify the source when investigating logging and traces. It also makes the subjects to communicate over the message broker with unique.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.InternalLogger
member.summary: The logger instance that will not throw exceptions.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient._session
member.summary: The session with the message broker.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient._messageProcessor
member.summary: Responsible for queueing and processing the incoming NATS messages.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient._responseHandlers
member.summary: Mapping from the command type to the function handling said command.
member.remarks: Any new request type for this handler should be added in PrepareResponseHandlers().

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient._natsDxmTimeoutTimer
member.summary: A watchdog timer to check if the DxM on NATS is still sending messages (responses, events, or heartbeats). Will disconnect when breached.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient._natsHeartbeatRequiredTimer
member.summary: A watchdog timer to check if there has been inactivity for too long and a heartbeat message needs to be sent to the DxM. When the DxM does not receive any message from us, it will forcibly close the connection.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient._emptyRequestBytes
member.summary: Often an empty request is needed (e.g. for heartbeats), so to avoid the memory trouble it is created just once. It cannot be made a value in the class definition as it is generated from a proto file.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient._isDxmConnected
member.summary: A property cannot be made volatile, so a private member is used to hold the connected state as volatile.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient._isFullyDisconnected
member.summary: Boolean to know if a full disconnect was requested.
member.remarks: This avoids the race condition where the timeout timer and heartbeat would try to reconnect when the disconnect was requested at the same time.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient._nodeId
member.summary: The ID of the node that will take care of setting up the gRPC connection. This will be the first CommunicationGateway DxM running a gRPC module that replies to the discovery request.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient._workloadMonitor
member.summary: Allows you to retrieve a snapshot of some workload-related information.
Constructs a gRPC client that will use the CommunicationGateway DxM to connect to a device. The connection is only set up when Connect() is called.
member.param: The DataMiner Agent ID of the element if applicable. Becomes part of the channel ID and helps identify the source when investigating logging and traces.
The element ID of the element if applicable. Becomes part of the channel ID and helps identify the source when investigating logging and traces.
A descriptive name for this channel, to differentiate the logging if multiple channels are logging to the same file.
The details needed to find and connect to the endpoint.
The interface that will be called for any logging.
The service group for which a middleware client needs to be created.
member.exception: The channelName should not be or empty or whitespace.
The value should be a NATS token-friendly name.

member.summary: Constructs a gRPC client that will use the CommunicationGateway DxM to connect to a device. The connection is only set up when Connect() is called.
member.param: The channel ID helps identify the source when investigating logging and traces.
A descriptive name for this channel, to differentiate the logging if multiple channels are logging to the same file.
The details needed to find and connect to the endpoint.
The interface that will be called for any logging.
If provided, overwrites the default internal settings, intended for unit and integration tests.
The service group for which a middleware client needs to be created.
member.exception: The channelName should not be or empty or whitespace.
The value should be a NATS token-friendly name.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.ChangeConfiguration(Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.DataSourceConfiguration)
member.exception: The input argument should not be .
There was an exception when setting up the connection.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.Unsubscribe(System.String)
member.exception: Removing the subscription failed.
Name of the subscription cannot be , empty, or a whitespace.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.AddConnectionMetadata(Skyline.DataMiner.Protobuf.CommunicationGateway.Grpc.Api.Model.v1.GrpcMetadata)
member.summary: Adds metadata key-value pairs to the gRPC channel's metadata that is sent with every request. Duplicate keys will be dropped and will not be present in the return value.
member.param: The metadata to add to the existing metadata for this channel.
member.returns: The values that were actually added to the channel's metadata.
member.exception: When the DxM returned an error code.
When a response is expected from the DxM, but there was no response or it was a null reference.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.RemoveConnectionMetadata(System.String[])
member.summary: Removes metadata keys and their associated values from the gRPC channel's metadata that is sent with every request. Keys that cannot be found will not be present in the return value. Note that keys for binary values (byte arrays) should end with "-bin".
member.param: The collection of keys that should be removed from this channel's gRPC metadata.
member.returns: The collection of keys that were actually removed.
member.exception: When the DxM returned an error code.
When a response is expected from the DxM, but there was no response or it was a null reference.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.Dispose
member.summary: The dispose will also call Disconnect.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.IsAllConnectionStateChanges
member.summary: Boolean indicating if OnConnectionStateChanged should always be called when connect state changes, even if an internal reconnect happens that briefly will call disconnect and connect.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.OnConnectionStateChanged(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Triggers the execution of the ConnectionStateChanged event handler.
member.param: Event arguments to be passed to the invoke of the ConnectionStateChanged event handler.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disposing the object.
member.param: Boolean indicating if the dispose needs to disconnect and clean up the resources.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.PrepareResponseHandlersInternal
member.summary: Add the response handlers to the lookup table. It is called during the constructor before any subscriptions are made. It should not be called by the inheriting class.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.AddResponseHandler(System.String,System.Action{Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Models.ResponseArguments})
member.summary: Adds a response handler to execute when a message is received on the corresponding subject token. Should only be called while PrepareResponseHandlers is being called, since the mapping is not thread-safe.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.Subscribe(Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Models.ASubscriptionContext)
member.summary: Subscribe to a data stream. Will store the data handler, then register the subscription, and finally push the subscription details. The subscription ID in the context must be unique.
member.param: Details of the subscription.
member.exception: When the DxM returned an error code.
When a response is expected from the DxM, but there was no response or it was a null reference.
The subscriptionContext must contain a unique subscription ID that is not null or empty.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.SubscribeInternal(Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Models.ASubscriptionContext)
member.summary: Subscribe to a data stream. Will register the subscription first and then push the subscription details. The handler will not be stored, nor will its subscription ID be checked locally.
member.param: Details of the subscription.
member.exception: When the DxM returned an error code.
When a response is expected from the DxM, but there was no response or it was a null reference.
The subscriptionContext must contain a subscription ID that is not null or empty.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.EnsureIsSubscribedToResponses
member.summary: Makes the subscription with the message broker if this would not be the case yet.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.ConnectInternal(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Registers the channel with a CommunicationGateway DxM and makes the DxM attempt a connection with the endpoint.
member.param: Boolean to know if the connect request is initiated from a timeout.
Boolean indicating if the ConnectionStateChanged needs to be called.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.ResubscribeAfterReconnect
member.summary: Attempt to recreate the known subscriptions after the connection has been re-established.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.VerifyConnectResult(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Verifies the response from the ConnectRequest to determine if the request was successful or not.
member.param: Response of the connect request.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.DisconnectInternal(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disconnects from the current channel, but only removes the subscriptions when requested. If the subscriptions are retained, the DxM timeout timer will be kept alive and will trigger occasional Connect attempts.
member.param: Boolean indicating if the DxM timeout timer needs to stay active.
Boolean indicating if the ConnectionStateChanged needs to be called.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.ClearSubscriptionHandlers
member.summary: Clears the subscription handlers when the connection is broken and the handlers do not need to be retained.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.ReconnectInternal
member.summary: Disconnects and connects again.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.LogException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Logs an error message if the logger exists.
member.param: Exception to be logged.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.AMiddlewareClient.LogIfError(CommunicationGateway.Grpc.Api.ErrorCode)
member.summary: Logs the error code with its friendly name as a warning if the code is not OK. The full description is logged on the debug level.
member.param: Error code to be logged.

Event arguments.

Event arguments.

member.summary: An interface that makes it possible to log.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.ILogger.LogFatal(System.String)
member.summary: Logs a message when the process encountered a problem that could not be handled without loss of functionality. Recommended DataMiner log level: ERROR, ALWAYS
member.param: Message to be logged.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.ILogger.LogError(System.String)

member.param: Message to be logged.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.ILogger.LogWarning(System.String)

member.param: Message to be logged.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.ILogger.LogInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Logs a message for fundamental process execution. Recommended DataMiner log level: INFO, 0-1
member.param: Message to be logged.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.ILogger.LogDebug(System.String)
member.summary: Logs a message when an action is undertaken. Recommended DataMiner log level: DEBUG, 1-3
member.param: Message to be logged.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.ILogger.LogTrace(System.String)
member.summary: Logs a message to trace every action or function call being executed. Recommended DataMiner log level: DEBUG, 5
member.param: Message to be logged.

member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.IMiddlewareClient
member.summary:
A class that represents a single gRPC connection that can be used to handle a particular gRPC service's communication. This requires the CommunicationGateway DxM to be available.
'Channel' refers to a virtual connection to a conceptual endpoint in the DxM. 'Connection' refers to an active gRPC (HTTP2) connection with an endpoint. 'DataSource' refers to a conceptual endpoint and its identifying parameters.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.IMiddlewareClient.ChannelId
member.summary: The channel ID helps identify the source when investigating logging and traces. It also makes the subjects to communicate over the message broker with unique.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.IMiddlewareClient.ChannelName
member.summary: The name assigned to this channel for users to identify it more easily than with the channel ID.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.IMiddlewareClient.Logger
member.summary: The logger instance that is wrapped so it will not throw exceptions.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.IMiddlewareClient.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets a boolean indicating if there is a connection with the channel.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.IMiddlewareClient.WorkloadMonitor
member.summary: Allows you to retrieve a snapshot of some workload-related information.

member.name: E:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.IMiddlewareClient.ConnectionStateChanged
member.summary: Action that will be called when the connection state has changed.

member.name: E:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.IMiddlewareClient.SubscriptionDataCleared
member.summary: Action that will be called when the subscription handlers have been cleared. This is expected to happen on a disconnect from the API, but not when the connection is lost and an attempt is made to reconnect automatically.

member.name: E:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.IMiddlewareClient.SubscriptionLost
member.summary: Action that will be called when a subscription is lost and could not be recovered. The LostSubscriptionArgs will include details about the lost subscription.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.IMiddlewareClient.ChangeConfiguration(Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.DataSourceConfiguration)
member.summary: When the configuration is different, this will trigger a disconnect and update the data source configuration to then reconnect.
member.param: Configuration to be used when connecting.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.IMiddlewareClient.Connect
member.summary: Registers the channel with a CommunicationGateway DxM and makes the DxM attempt a connection with the endpoint.
member.exception: There was an exception when setting up the connection.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.IMiddlewareClient.Disconnect
member.summary: Closes the connection with the endpoint and unregisters the channel with the DxM.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.IMiddlewareClient.Unsubscribe(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a subscription from the endpoint.
member.param: The name of the subscription to unsubscribe from.

member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.IWorkloadMonitor
member.summary: Makes it possible to retrieve a snapshot of some workload-related information.

member.name: E:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.IWorkloadMonitor.QueueFull
member.summary: Occurs when the queue reaches its maximum capacity.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.IWorkloadMonitor.GetNumberItemsInQueue(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the number of items in the queue for a subscription of choice.
member.returns: The number of items in the queue.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Models.ClientInternalSettings.MessageBroker
member.summary: The message broker to contact the CommunicationGateway with.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Models.ClientInternalSettings.HeartbeatSettings
member.summary: Heartbeat settings should not be adjusted for production since they need to be in sync with the CommunicationGateway. However, they can be altered to speed up or disable the timeout times for unit tests.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Models.ClientInternalSettings.StaleItemCleanupTimeSpan
member.summary: How often the callback thread pool should check for stale collections, since each subscription will have its own collection.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Models.ClientInternalSettings.WorkItemsGroupMaxSize
member.summary: The number of items that can be queued in a thread pool collection. Each subscription has its own collection that will be capped.

member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageProcessor
member.summary:
Responsible for adding the incoming NATS messages on a queue per subscription. When a certain subscription is not receiving messages, it is marked as idle, and the worker associated with it will be cleaned up.
Will process both internal subscriptions (e.g. keep-alive messages) as subscriptions created by a connector.

member.name: E:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageProcessor.QueueFull
member.summary: Occurs when the queue reaches its maximum capacity.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageProcessor._messageQueueWorkers
member.summary: Contains the workers that process the queue per subscription ID.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageProcessor._logger
member.summary: Allows to log in the log file of the middleware consumer (e.g. element log file).

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageProcessor._staleQueueWorkerCleanupScheduler
member.summary: Responsible for periodically checking whether there are workers with a stale queue. Will then mark those workers as such, resulting in them being cleaned up as soon as there is no further work to be done.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageProcessor._timeBeforeQueueConsideredStale
member.summary: When no messages are added to the queue for a certain period of time, it will be marked as stale. The worker thread responsible for processing that queue will be stopped.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageProcessor._boundedCapacity
member.summary: The maximum number of messages that are allowed in the queue. Incoming messages that cannot be added to the queue will be dropped.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageProcessor.AddMessage(DataMinerMessageBroker.API.IMessage,System.Action{DataMinerMessageBroker.API.IMessage})
member.summary: Adds a message to the queue of an active worker. Will automatically create a new worker in case it is the first message for a certain subscription.
member.param: The message that needs to be added to the queue.
An action that needs to be executed on the message.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageProcessor.GetNumberItemsInQueue(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the number of items that are currently in a specific subscription queue.
member.param: The subscription for which the number of items in the queue need to be retrieved.
member.returns: The number of items in the queue or 0 if no subscription with that name exists.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageProcessor.CleanupStaleQueueWorkers(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks the queues that are stale and removes those from the active workers.
member.param: Not used

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageProcessor.NeedsMessageQueueWorker(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether a needs to be created for a certain subscription subject. There are some internal subscriptions for which the messages actually just need to be handled immediately.
member.param: The subject of the subscription.
member.returns: Whether a needs to be created.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageProcessor.OnQueueFull(System.Object,Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Models.QueueFullEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the event.
member.param: The that initially triggered it.
Event data containing information about the queue state.

member.name: E:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageQueueWorker.QueueFull
member.summary: Occurs when the queue reaches its maximum capacity.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageQueueWorker._queue
member.summary: The queue to which the messages are added to be processed.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageQueueWorker._name
member.summary: A name for the worker that will be used for logging purposes.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageQueueWorker._cancellationTokenSource
member.summary: Allows you to cancel the worker.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageQueueWorker._logger
member.summary: Allows to log in the log file of the middleware consumer (e.g. element log file).

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageQueueWorker._worker
member.summary: The worker thread that gets spun up to process the queue.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageQueueWorker._lastAddedMessageTimeUtc
member.summary: Will contain the date and time of when the last message was added to the queue.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageQueueWorker._lastFullQueueLogTimeUtc
member.summary: The last time that the queue was logged as full. This allows the system to keep some time in between the log occurrences.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageQueueWorker._droppedMessagesSinceLastLogAttempt
member.summary: Gives an indication of how many messages are being dropped from the queue.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageQueueWorker._boundedCapacity
member.summary: The maximum number of messages that are allowed in the queue. Incoming messages that cannot be added to the queue will be dropped.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageQueueWorker.Count
member.summary: The current number of items available in the queue.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageQueueWorker.IsQueueStale(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
Checks whether the queue is considered stale, meaning that no messages have been added for a certain period of time.
If no message has ever been added to the queue, it will not be considered stale.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageQueueWorker.MarkQueueStale
member.summary: Marks the queue as stale, which means that no new messages can be added to it. The worker will continue to process all the messages that were still in the queue.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Utils.MessageQueueWorker.MessageDropped(DataMinerMessageBroker.API.IMessage)
member.summary: Delegate that will go off when a message is being dropped from the channel. Will keep track of the number of dropped messages and log this every minute.
member.param: The message that has been dropped from the channel
